entry.title: Land Swap for Roseburg's Charter Oaks Heads to State Legislature
entry.summary: A proposed state bill would fast-track Roseburg’s Charter Oaks expansion by bypassing regulatory delays through a land swap with Douglas County. If passed, it could reshape how Oregon handles contested urban growth.

entry.title: Land swap moves to legislature
entry.summary: Roseburg’s long-planned expansion into the Charter Oaks neighborhood undertook a new strategy this week with a legislative proposal brought to the state capital by Rep. Virgle Osborne, R-Roseburg, and Sen. David Brock Smith, R-Port Orford.

entry.title: Crater Lake's Only Legal Access Trail to Close for Years Starting in 2026
entry.summary: Crater Lake’s Cleetwood Cove Trail—the only legal access to the lake—will close in 2026 for major renovations. No swimming or boating will be allowed until at least 2029, as the park improves safety, infrastructure, and the marina. 2025 will be the last chance for lake access for years.
